member.name: T:Devlooped.DiagnosticExtensions
member.summary: Adds diagnostic mutating extensions.

member.name: M:Devlooped.DiagnosticExtensions.IsKind(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DiagnosticDescriptor,Devlooped.DiagnosticKind)
member.summary: Checks whether the given will be used for the given diagnostic kind when the default executes.

member.name: M:Devlooped.DiagnosticExtensions.With(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DiagnosticDescriptor,System.String,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.LocalizableString,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.LocalizableString,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.LocalizableString,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a copy of the given with selected values replaced.
member.param: The original descriptor.
A unique identifier for the diagnostic. For example, code analysis diagnostic ID "CA1001".
A short localizable title describing the diagnostic. For example, for CA1001: "Types that own disposable fields should be disposable".

A localizable format message string, which can be passed as the first argument to when creating the diagnostic message with this descriptor. For example, for CA1001: "Implement IDisposable on '{0}' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: '{1}'."
An optional longer localizable description of the diagnostic.
An optional hyperlink that provides a more detailed description regarding the diagnostic.

member.name: T:Devlooped.DiagnosticKind
member.summary: The kind of SponsorLink diagnostic being reported.

member.name: F:Devlooped.DiagnosticKind.AppNotInstalled
member.summary: The SponsorLink GitHub is not installed on the user's personal account.

member.name: F:Devlooped.DiagnosticKind.UserNotSponsoring
member.summary: The user is not sponsoring the given sponsor account.

member.name: F:Devlooped.DiagnosticKind.Thanks
member.summary: The user has the SponsorLink GitHub app installed and is sponsoring the given sponsor account.

member.name: T:Devlooped.SponsorStatus
member.summary: The sponsoring status.

member.name: F:Devlooped.SponsorStatus.AppMissing
member.summary: The SponsorLink GitHub is not installed on the user's personal account.

member.name: F:Devlooped.SponsorStatus.NotSponsoring
member.summary: The user is not sponsoring the given sponsor account.

member.name: F:Devlooped.SponsorStatus.Sponsoring
member.summary: The user has the SponsorLink GitHub app installed and is sponsoring the given sponsor account.

member.name: T:Devlooped.SponsorCheck
member.summary: Allows directly checking the sponsor status from any consuming code, such as command line app, build task or analyzer.

member.name: M:Devlooped.SponsorCheck.CheckAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Net.Http.HttpClient)
member.summary: Checks the sponsoring status with the given parameters.
member.param: The working directory to use for the check. Used to determine the git email to use, since this can be overriden per repository.
The sponsor account that should be sponsored by the user.
The name of the product being checked.
Optional package identifier used for telemetry. Defaults to .
Optional package version used for telemetry. Defaults to empty.
Optional with custom settings (i.e. proxy, timeout).
member.returns: The or if status cannot be checked (for example if the network is unavailable, the doesn't exist or a configured git email cannot be determined for the check.

member.name: T:Devlooped.SponsorLink
member.summary: Provides build-time checks for sponsorships. Derived classes must annotate derived classes with both as well as in order for SponsorLink to function properly.

member.name: P:Devlooped.SponsorLink.Diagnostics
member.summary: Manages the sharing and reporting of diagnostics across the source generator and the diagnostic analyzer, to avoid doing the online check more than once.

member.name: M:Devlooped.SponsorLink.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes SponsorLink with the given sponsor account and product name, for fully customized diagnostics. You must override and for this to work.
member.param: The sponsor account that users should sponsor.
The name of product that is using sponsor link.
member.remarks: This constructor overload allows full customization of reported diagnostics. The base class won't report anything in this case and just expose the support diagnostics from and invoke for the various supported sponsoring scenarios.

member.name: M:Devlooped.SponsorLink.#ctor(Devlooped.SponsorLinkSettings)
member.summary: Initializes the analyzer with the default behavior configured with the given settings. The specific diagnostics supported and reported are managed by the base class and require no additional overrides or customizations.
member.param: The settings for the analyzer and generator.

member.name: P:Devlooped.SponsorLink.SupportedDiagnostics
member.summary: Exposes the supported diagnostics.

member.name: M:Devlooped.SponsorLink.OnDiagnostic(System.String,Devlooped.DiagnosticKind)
member.summary: Performs an action when the given diagnostic is verified for the current user. If an actual diagnostic should be reported, a non-null value can be returned.
member.remarks: Returns null if no diagnostics should be reported for the given diagnostic .

member.name: M:Devlooped.SponsorLink.CheckAndReport(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Diagnostics.CompilationAnalysisContext,Devlooped.SponsorLink.BuildInfo)
member.summary: Runs a full check against URLs for sponsorship status. Only runs on full, editor builds.

member.name: M:Devlooped.SponsorLink.ReportExisting(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Diagnostics.CompilationAnalysisContext,System.String)
member.summary: In DTB, we merely re-surface diagnostics that were previously generated in a full build. This keeps the checks minimally impactful while still being visible.

member.name: T:Devlooped.SponsorLink.BuildInfo
member.summary: Provides information about the build that was checked for sponsor linking. Used internally only for now.

member.summary: The full path of the project being built.

member.name: P:Devlooped.SponsorLink.BuildInfo.DesignTimeBuild

member.summary: Whether to always run the check and report issues.

member.name: P:Devlooped.SponsorLink.BuildInfo.InstallTime
member.summary: The installation/restore time of SponsorLink.

member.name: T:Devlooped.SponsorLinkSettings
member.summary: Configures the default behavior of the analyzer/generator.
member.remarks: The default behavior configured by this class is applied in the virtual method. If overriden, none of these settings are actually used.

member.name: M:Devlooped.SponsorLinkSettings.Create(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates the settings for with the given values.
member.param: The sponsor account to check for sponsorships.
The product that uses SponsorLink. Used in diagnostics to clarify the product requesting the sponsor link check.

member.name: M:Devlooped.SponsorLinkSettings.Create(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates the settings for with the given values.
member.param: The sponsor account to check for sponsorships.
The product that uses SponsorLink. Used in diagnostics to clarify the product requesting the sponsor link check.

Optional NuGet package identifier of the product performing the check. Defaults to . Used to determine installation time of the product and avoid pausing builds or emitting warnings during the quiet days after install (configurable using another overload).
Prefix to use for diagnostics with numbers 02,03,04 reported by default. If not provided, a default one is determined from the and values.
Min random milliseconds to apply during build for non-sponsoring users. Use 0 for no pause.
Max random milliseconds to apply during build for non-sponsoring users. Use 0 for no pause.

member.name: M:Devlooped.SponsorLinkSettings.Create(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Creates the settings for with the given values.
member.param: The sponsor account to check for sponsorships.
The product that uses SponsorLink. Used in diagnostics to clarify the product requesting the sponsor link check.

Optional NuGet package identifier of the product performing the check. Defaults to . Used to determine installation time of the product and avoid pausing builds or emitting warnings during the after install.
Optional product or package version.
Prefix to use for diagnostics with numbers 02,03,04 reported by default. If not provided, a default one is determined from the and values.
Min random milliseconds to apply during build for non-sponsoring users. Use 0 for no pause.
Max random milliseconds to apply during build for non-sponsoring users. Use 0 for no pause.
Optional days to keep warnings quiet so the user has a chance to test the product undisturbed.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnscopedRefAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate a byref escapes and is not scoped.

remarks.para: There are several cases where the C# compiler treats a as implicitly - where the compiler does not allow the to escape the method.

For example:
for instance methods.
parameters that refer to types.
parameters.
This attribute is used in those instances where the should be allowed to escape.

Applying this attribute, in any form, has impact on consumers of the applicable API. It is necessary for API authors to understand the lifetime implications of applying this attribute and how it may impact their users.

member.name: T:System.Index
member.summary: Represent a type can be used to index a collection either from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct an Index using a value and indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.param: The index value. it has to be zero or positive number.
Indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.remarks: If the Index constructed from the end, index value 1 means pointing at the last element and index value 0 means pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: P:System.Index.Start
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at first element.

member.name: P:System.Index.End
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromStart(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the start at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the start.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the end at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the end.

member.name: P:System.Index.Value
member.summary: Returns the index value.

member.name: P:System.Index.IsFromEnd
member.summary: Indicates whether the index is from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.GetOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the offset from the start using the giving collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the Index will be used with. length has to be a positive value
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter and the returned offset value against negative values. we don't validate either the returned offset is greater than the input length. It is expected Index will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. If the returned offset is negative and then used to index a collection will get out of range exception which will be same affect as the validation.

member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Index.Equals(System.Index)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another Index object.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.summary: Converts integer number to an Index.

member.name: M:System.Index.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of the current Index object to its equivalent string representation.

member.name: M:System.Range.GetOffsetAndLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the start offset and length of range object using a collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the range will be used with. length has to be a positive value.
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter against negative values. It is expected Range will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. We validate the range is inside the length scope though.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsExternalInit

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ModuleInitializerAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate to the compiler that a method should be called in its containing module's initializer.
member.remarks:
When one or more valid methods with this attribute are found in a compilation, the compiler will emit a module initializer which calls each of the attributed methods.
Certain requirements are imposed on any method targeted with this attribute: - The method must be `static`. - The method must be an ordinary member method, as opposed to a property accessor, constructor, local function, etc. - The method must be parameterless. - The method must return `void`. - The method must not be generic or be contained in a generic type. - The method's effective accessibility must be `internal` or `public`.
The specification for module initializers in the .NET runtime can be found here: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/design/specs/Ecma-335-Augments.md#module-initializer

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RequiredMemberAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a type has required members or that a member is required.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.SkipLocalsInitAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate to the compiler that the .locals init flag should not be set in method headers.

member.name: P:ThisAssembly.Strings.MissingDesignTimeBuild.Description
member.summary: = "This is typically a package authoring error which can be fixed by installing the Devlooped.SponsorLink package or adding the following MSBuild item to the project: <CompilerVisibleProperty Include="DesignTimeBuild" />."

member.summary: = "SponsorLink analyzer did not receive the required DesignTimeBuild compiler-visible property."

member.summary: = "SponsorLink analyzer did not receive the required MSBuildProjectFullPath compiler-visible property."
